title: Sampler, late 19th century
medium:
Medium: wool and silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation
description: Most of a border of geometric pattern lozenges, some containing adages: "Forget me not," "Token of Love," and "Respect,"  worked in brown, green, and beige. The sampler was added to at a later date, with spot motifs in bright colors, some geometric but also including a lamb, dogs, a butterfly, baskets of flowers and a teakettle.

exhibitions.title: Hella Jongerius Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, late 19th century.
late 19th century. Medium: wool and silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, stem, and satin stitches on plain weave foundation. Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer. 1981-28-148.
